statement.tex: \text{Examine the continuity of }\\ \qquad f(x) = 2x^2 -1 \text{ at } x = 3.

step.context: \text{If a function }f(x)\text{ is continuous at}\\ \text{at a point }x = a, \text{ then }\ldots
step.reason: \text{If a function is continuous at a point, }\\ \text{then it can be drawn without lifting the}\\ \text{pencil. However, if }\lim_{x\to a^-}f(x)\neq\lim_{x\to a^+}f(x)\text{ or }\\ \lim_{x\to a}f(x)\neq f(a),\text{ then one will have to lift}\\ \text{the pencil}\implies\text{ discontinuity.}

step.context: \text{Which of the following analysis and }\\ \text{conclusions is correct?}
step.reason: \text{Check your calculations. You should find}\\ \lim_{x\to 3}f(x) = f(x)\implies\text{ continuity.}
